net.stemkoski.bagel

Class Vector2

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.stemkoski.bagel.Vector2
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Comparable<Vector2>

    public class Vector2
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Comparable<Vector2>
    A two-dimensional vector (x,y), particularly useful for representing velocity and acceleration (see Physics), and minimum translation vectors for collision resolution (see Rectangle, TileMap).

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      double x
      x-coordinate of the vector
      double y
      y-coordinate of the vector

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Vector2()
      Initializes vector coordinates to (0,0).
      Vector2(double x, double y)
      Initializes vector coordinates to (x,y).

      Add the values of the coordinates of other vector to the coordinates of this vector.
      int compareTo(Vector2 other)
      Required method from Comparable interface; used to sort collections of Vector2 objects by length, particularly for use in determining the minimum (shortest) translation vector for use in resolving collisions with solid objects.

      Calculate the angle (in degrees) between this vector and the x-axis (the vector (1,0)).

      • getAngle

        public double getAngle()
        Calculate the angle (in degrees) between this vector and the x-axis (the vector (1,0)). If this vector is the zero vector, returns 0. Return values are in the range from -180 to +180.
        Returns:
        the angle between this vector and the x-axis

      • setLength

        public void setLength(double length)
        Changes the length of this vector to length while preserving the angle of this vector.
        Parameters:
        length - the new length of this vector

      • setAngle

        public void setAngle(double angleDegrees)
        Changes the angle of this vector to angleDegrees while preserving the length of this vector.
        Parameters:
        angleDegrees - the new angle (in degrees) between this vector and the x-axis

      • compareTo

        public int compareTo(Vector2 other)
        Required method from Comparable interface; used to sort collections of Vector2 objects by length, particularly for use in determining the minimum (shortest) translation vector for use in resolving collisions with solid objects.
        Specified by:
        compareTo in interface java.lang.Comparable<Vector2>
        Parameters:
        other - the vector being compared against this vector
        Returns:
        +1 if this vector is larger than other vector, -1 if other vector is larger than this vector, 0 if vectors have same length
        See Also:
        Comparable.compareTo(java.lang.Object)
